content.description:
Walk into the corridor between Cyclops Rock and the Potato Head formation. The route is on the left side of the Potato Head's west face.

It's a left-slanting crack with a crux finish. Be forewarned that after topping out you must walk back from the edge about twenty feet before finding a crack suitable for an anchor.

Walk south, descending a slab to reach the ground.
content.protection: Small to medium cams, or medium nuts.

content.description: Start off battling an awkward bulge. Then work those knee bars, heel-toes, and chicken wings as you slither and grovel up the OW until it finally lowers angle. Features on the left wall allow for good rests. I brought two 6" pieces and bumped one up to use for the anchor.
content.protection: 4"-6", if you belay at the first big ledge the anchor takes 2"-6"
content.location: The obvious wide crack in a right-facing corner in the middle of the northwest face. Walk off the southeast side.

climbs.name: Masochism
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tom Burke, Derrick Reinich, Cyndie Bransford, Mike

content.description: This bolt protected route climbs decent face features up above and to the right of Tubers in Space. I saw this route walking around the cyclops it has Todd Gordon written all over it so we had to climb it.
content.location: As you walk around cyclops to the Northeast you will see this route on the face across from Overnight Sensation. The route faces SW. Start as for Tubers in Space and climb directly up the face to the first bolt. Walk off to the East.

content.description: This obscurity climbs an attractive but gritty series of huecos in mottled brown rock. Presently equipped with a bolted anchor and a single bolt, this current top-rope might make a nice lead close to the car with the addition of a few more bolts.
content.location:
Located in a narrow east-facing corridor around and left from

Rick's Solo

.

content.description: Start from the vertical crack to the right of the leftward slanting crack (Tubers in Space).  Gingerly traverse left until you can mantle the ramps to access the sweet vertical jam crack high in the middle of the face. Finish above.
content.protection: Pro to 2.5".  Long slings through the leftward traverse. In the traverse, a BD #2 in the just-deep-enough pocket fits decently.

content.description:
Start as for

Masochism

then move right up a slanting ramp system to access a left-slanting hand-crack finish.
